intro: Oxytropis argyroleuca, commonly known as silverleaf locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its silvery-white foliage and erect, branching stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis argyroleuca is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open plains. It is considered a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with compound leaves and a distinctive appearance that makes it recognizable in its native habitat.
